revised_title: Optical and Physical Effects of High Explosives: Formation of Solid Copper Pellets and Detonation Mechanisms
tldr: The author investigates the effects of high explosives, particularly the formation of solid copper pellets during detonation. They discover that the pellets form due to a plastic flow of the metal under high instantaneous pressure, and propose a hypothesis explaining their formation. The author also studies the secondary flash of detonation and the enormous velocity at which the reaction propagates.
